author: Miranda Levingston
title: Bryant Park Grill's Lease Is Up After 30 Years, Owner Not Budging | Midtown, NY Patch
text:
Restaurants & Bars
NYC Eatery Won‚Äôt Vacate For New Tenant Despite Lease Expiration
A long-standing restaurant is digging its heels in after its lease expires.
BRYANT PARK, NY ‚Äî There's a food fight escalating in Bryant Park.
The Bryant Park Grill's lease expires on Wednesday after 30 years, but just as a new restaurant from celebrity chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten is preparing to take over, the owners of the Grill are refusing to leave.
‚ÄúWE‚ÄôRE NOT GOING ANYWHERE," Bryant Park Grill Owner Michael Weinstein told Patch over email Wednesday.
Find out what's happening in Midtown-Hell's Kitchenfor free with the latest updates from Patch.
According to a spokesperson for the Grill, the restaurant will remain open on Thursday and even has a Mother's Day menu on its website for May 9, despite the fact that the Jean-Georges restaurant has already signed a lease on the space.
This is the latest development in a saga that started at the end of March when the owner of the Bryant Park Grill sued its landlord, the Bryant Park Corporation, in an attempt to block the termination of their long-standing restaurant lease.
Find out what's happening in Midtown-Hell's Kitchenfor free with the latest updates from Patch.
In the suit, Ark Restaurants (which owns the Grill) accused its landlord of holding a "sham bidding process" that skewed the decision process toward a restaurant by celebrity chef Jean-Georges Vongerichten, which plans to take over the Grill's place.
The restaurateur also argued in the suit that the Bryant Park Corporation rejected the Grill's competitive bid, which was $1 million higher in annual rent than the Jean-Georges restaurant, and is handing over to a company with a "recent record of failure."
However, on April 23, Justice Anar Rathod Patel ruled the owners of the Grill had no legal right to an injunction blocking Jean-Georges from taking over the location, and said the bidding process was fair.
‚ÄúBryant Park Corporation intends to abide by the court decision issued last week and will exercise its rights at the conclusion of the current operator‚Äôs lease,‚Äù said Gil Feder of Loeb & Loeb, counsel for Bryant Park Corporation, told Patch on Wednesday.

author: Marcel Berrios
title: Addressing a Lack of Counseling Programs to Diminish the Psychological, Emotional, and Mental Impacts of Church Closure Grief
text:
Addressing a Lack of Counseling Programs to Diminish the Psychological, Emotional, and Mental Impacts of Church Closure Grief
Date
12-19-2024
Department
Rawlings School of Divinity
Degree
Doctor of Ministry (DMin)
Chair
Gregory Faulls
Keywords
Grief, Counseling, Church Closure, Interviews and Analysis, Panel Discussions, YouTube Channel, Brochures
Disciplines
Christianity | Counseling
Recommended Citation
Berrios, Marcel, "Addressing a Lack of Counseling Programs to Diminish the Psychological, Emotional, and Mental Impacts of Church Closure Grief" (2024). Doctoral Dissertations and Projects. 6412.
https://digitalcommons.liberty.edu/doctoral/6412
Abstract
Besides spiritual activities, the social activities that happen in church buildings are vital to the functioning of most communities; therefore, churches play a central role in the social fabric and social infrastructure of communities in ways not necessarily thought about until they are no longer around. The looming absence of this role or function of the church becomes the overarching focus to address when an announcement is made that a church is permanently closing. Lost in navigating the business and community aspects of a church closure is the congregation's metamorphic spiritual, emotional, and psychological journey. Subsequently, many church members are left to traverse unfamiliar feelings and stages of grief without an essential counseling forum.

author: @daily_trust
title: Gov Uba Sani approves new policies to boost health sector, address climate change - Daily Trust
text:
Kaduna State Governor, Senator Uba Sani has approved new policies to optimize and prioritize the state-owned Government Printing Department,advance the state‚Äôs healthcare sector and address climate change.
This approval was made known in a statement from the Kashim Ibrahim House after the State Executive Council Meeting that held on Thursday, 4th July 2024.
In proactive efforts to ensure maximum utilization and revenue generation, Governor Uba Sani has approved the revamping and repositioning of the state-owned Government Printing Department. This initiative will require all State Ministries, Departments, Agencies (MDAs) to use the Printing Department‚Äôs services for essential printing needs.
Additionally, at the State Executive Council meeting, Governor Uba Sani introduced the Kaduna State Human Resources for Health Policy (HRH), designed to address gaps in the health workforce. The policy was developed through extensive stakeholder consultations to ensure comprehensive recommendations for overcoming current challenges in the health sector.
‚Äò80% beneficiaries of Kaduna women empowerment loan defaulting‚Äô Unveiling The Secrets Of Nigeria‚Äôs Thriving Import-Export Industry ‚ÄúThe Human Resources for Health Policy will serve as a framework to ensure the right number and mix of competent, motivated, and equitably distributed health workers for optimal healthcare service delivery. Its strategic objectives include maintaining an adequate number of qualified health workers and managing employment, deployment, retention, and performance effectively,‚Äù said Governor Sani.
Similarly, Governor Sani also approved the Kaduna State Climate Change Policy, which provides a comprehensive framework to tackle the impact of climate change impacts, promote sustainability, and align with national and international climate goals.
‚ÄúThe 2024 Climate Change Policy addresses the increased extreme weather events and aligns with the National Climate Change Policy (2021-2030). Developed with input from various stakeholders and supported by organizations like ACReSAL and Lafiya Projects, this policy aims to reduce emissions, enhance climate resilience, and integrate climate considerations into state planning,‚Äù Governor Sani stated.
The policy will focus on public education, monitoring systems, and sustainable development initiatives to prepare Kaduna State for future climate challenges.
Governor Sani‚Äôs administration remains committed to investing in human capital, environmental sustainability, and efficient state operations through these new policies.

author: bdnews24.com
title: Heatwave sweeping over 11 Bangladesh districts threatens wider ar
text:
Published : 08 May 2025, 02:24 AM
After a week of respite from searing hot weather, a heatwave is sweeping across 11 districts as meteorologists predict it to spread in the coming days of summer.
In a bulletin of Wednesday evening, the Bangladesh Meteorological Department (BMD) said a mild heatwave was blowing over Khulna Division alongside Sirajganj district.
Khulna and Chuadanga recorded the highest temperature at 3.8¬∞C while the mercury topped at 35.7¬∞C in Dhaka.
Meteorologist Omar Faruq said, ‚ÄúThe temperature will continue rising until Sunday before dropping from the following day. The heatwave won‚Äôt dissipate in a day after starting to diminish, rather it‚Äôll happen gradually.‚Äù
When the mercury rises to between 36 and 38 degrees Celsius, meteorologists consider it a light heatwave. A moderate heatwave occurs between temperatures of 38-40 degrees Celsius. A severe heatwave occurs when the temperature exceeds 40 degrees Celsius.
According to the forecast, occasional gusty winds, lightning, showers or thundershowers may occur in one or two places in Mymensingh and Sylhet divisions over the next 24 hours from 6pm Wednesday.
The weather in other places of the country is likely to remain dry with the skies partly cloudy.
Over the next 24 hours, daytime temperatures may edge up 1 or 2¬∞C while the mercury is expected to rise slightly at night.

author: Seth Carlson
title: 10 MLB players expected to return in 2025 who fans may have forgotten about
text:
Injuries to big-name players crushed the hopes and dreams of many MLB franchises in 2024. Yet, it was the injury-ravaged Los Angeles Dodgers that managed to win it all last season.
Cruel irony aside, many notable players who sat out in 2024 are expected back for 2025. Here are 10 who fans may have forgotten about.
1. SP Lucas Giolito, Boston Red Sox
2023 stats: 33 starts, 184.1 innings pitched, 4.88 ERA
Signed to a two-year contract ahead of last season, Giolito tore his ulnar collateral ligament in his first spring training outing with the Boston Red Sox in March 2024, necessitating Tommy John surgery. He's expected back at spring training this season, however, and hopes to stay healthy this time around as part of a revamped pitching rotation in Boston.
2. RP Liam Hendriks, Boston Red Sox
2023 stats: Five games, five innings pitched, 5.40 ERA
Staying with the Red Sox, reliever Hendriks is expected back for the 2025 season after missing last year while rehabbing from Tommy John surgery. Hendriks is also a cancer survivor and was named the 2023 AL Comeback Player of the Year for his triumphant recovery.
3. SP Kyle Wright, Kansas City Royals
2023 stats: Seven starts, 31 innings pitched, 6.97 ERA
Once a top pitching prospect with the Atlanta Braves, Wright was traded to the Kansas City Royals in November 2023. He missed all of 2024 after undergoing a procedure to repair a torn shoulder capsule, but he is on track to return in 2025 after the Royals reinstated him from the 60-day injured list in December.
4. SP Dustin May, Los Angeles Dodgers
2023 stats: Nine starts, 48 innings pitched, 2.63 ERA
Sensing a theme here? May missed most of the 2023 season after having Tommy John surgery, but had a chance to a return in 2024 before tearing his esophagus. Fortunately, he's gearing up to join the World Champions in 2025.
5. SP Sandy Alcantara, Miami Marlins
2023 stats: 28 starts, 184.2 innings pitched, 4.14 ERA
Alcantara is the Marlins' ace and one of the most dominant pitchers in the sport when healthy. But just like others on this list, he went under the knife following his last appearance in 2023, resulting in a missed 2024 campaign. He looks to return early in 2025.
6. SS Ronny Mauricio, New York Mets
2023 stats: 101 at-bats, .248/.296/.347, two home runs
Mauricio debuted with the Mets in September 2023, but his first stint in Queens was cut short by a torn ACL, which the promising shortstop is still rehabbing as of early 2025. He isn't likely to be ready for spring training, but he is expected back sometime this season.
7. OF Jasson Dominguez, New York Yankees
2024 stats: 56 at-bats, .179/.313/.304, two home runs
Dominguez played briefly in 2024, but that could be forgotten between Tommy John surgery in September 2023 and an oblique injury suffered in 2024. He never made it back after that, but Yankees general manager Brian Cashman wants the touted prospect to "get his shot" in 2025.
8. C Endy Rodriguez, Pittsburgh Pirates
2023 stats: 186 at-bats, .220/.284/.328, three home runs
Rodriguez, a top prospect in the Pirates' organization, debuted in 2023 before succumbing to elbow surgery in 2024. He is on track for 2025, but given Pittsburgh's catching depth, he could find himself playing some first base.
9. SP Shane McClanahan, Tampa Bay Rays
2023 stats: 21 starts, 115 innings pitched, 3.29 ERA
McClanahan is the Rays' ace, but he had Tommy John surgery in August 2023, forcing him to miss all of 2024. However, Tampa Bay now expects the southpaw to toss "150-ish" innings in 2025.
10. RP Felix Bautista, Baltimore Orioles
2023 stats: 56 games, 33 saves, 1.48 ERA
The Orioles missed closer Bautista in 2024 after the he needed elbow surgery in August 2023. The dominant closer is rumored to be healthy heading into 2025, per manager Brandon Hyde, which is great news for Baltimore.

author: Jarvis the NPC
title: Clash Royale: Performance Anxiety Strikes Again!
text:
Clash Royale has long been a sanctuary for strategic minds and casual gamers alike, but it seems that even the fiercest of players can experience a bout of performance anxiety now and then. A recent post by a user named Thefishthatdrowns has sparked a hilarious and relatable thread in the community, where players have chimed in with their own interpretations of why the game can sometimes feel overwhelming. The post, simply titled ‚ÄúOk‚Ä¶‚Äù features just a few words, ‚ÄúThis game blows,‚Äù encapsulating a moment of frustration that so many players can connect with while stirring up their fair share of laughs across the sub. With the community jumping in with quips and witticisms, this thread illustrates not only the trials of online gaming but also the laughter that arises from shared experiences.
Summary
- A user laments the frustrations of Clash Royale in a lighthearted tone, eliciting a volley of humorous responses from the community.
- The responses range from clever puns to relatable anecdotes on performance issues, revealing a shared understanding among players.
- Players jokingly analyze the original poster‚Äôs gameplay blunders, showcasing the entertaining side of community interactions.
- This thread exemplifies how humor can serve as a coping mechanism for the frustrations inherent in competitive gaming.
The Age of Performance Anxiety
It‚Äôs a moment we‚Äôve all experienced: you‚Äôre in a high-stakes match, and the pressure is on. You find yourself questioning your choices‚Äîdid you build the right deck? Is your opponent using that overpowered card you forgot to counter? The original poster, Thefishthatdrowns, captures this sentiment perfectly with the phrase, ‚ÄúThis game blows.‚Äù And boy, did the comments pile up! Right off the bat, MysticWarriorYT_ quipped, ‚ÄúBro got performance anxiety üò≠,‚Äù which perfectly sums up the situation. It‚Äôs a light-hearted way to acknowledge the inner turmoil that hits even the best players. When you can‚Äôt seem to get your cards to cooperate, suddenly forgetting how to defend against a charge becomes a universal nightmare. The irony is not lost on anyone here; gaming can be both exhilarating and nerve-wracking, often all wrapped into one frantic round of Clash Royale.
Humor as a Reliever
The comment section turned into a comedy show in record time, with players showcasing their humorous takes on the original post. There‚Äôs something about collective frustration that breeds camaraderie. Aggravating_Truck268 mentioned that the player had ‚Äúpass royale,‚Äù hinting at the premium advantage that some players might have. It was the initiation of a friendly roast‚Äîa rite of passage in any gaming community. Comments started bouncing around about ‚Äúelectro dysfunction‚Äù courtesy of Moleratgaming, who humorously lamented that the original poster seemed to have a crisis with their Electro Wizard. The laughter in the thread not only celebrates the struggle of Clash Royale but also reinforces that gaming is, at its core, meant to be fun. Watching someone‚Äôs bad day at the arena might just provide the comic relief that someone else needs in their gaming journey.
Relatable Gameplay Blunders
As the comments continued, it became evident that players were enjoying themselves by dissecting one another‚Äôs gameplay. Epic-Dude001 humorously pointed out how the poster ‚Äúreally pulled a Firecracker,‚Äù a metaphorical nod to how unpredictably and explosively matches can often go wrong. But wait, there‚Äôs more! Not only were players critiquing the performances in jest, but they were also sharing stories of their personal blunders amid the hype and excitement of competitive matches. A particularly memorable comment from Master_876_6830 elaborated on how daunting it would be to battle facing down a flying witch summoning undead skeletons while a knight sprinting on a horse charges toward your tower. This creative image perfectly captures the chaos of Clash Royale, where a single second can morph into either a tremendous win or a cringeworthy loss. It ties back into the original sentiment of the post‚Äîa tiny defeat that feels amplified in the moment, yet full of charm and drama.
The Unpredictable Nature of Clash Royale
The beauty of Clash Royale lies in its unpredictability, more so during those high-pressure moments that make your hands sweat and heart race. It takes skill, strategy, and, of course, a bit of luck to come out on top. Yet, the unpredictability can lead to baffling moments of confusion and frustration. With comments highlighting the hilarity of sudden mistakes, players like No_Nail_6665 admitted, ‚Äú*I know I shouldn‚Äôt laugh, but‚Ä¶‚Äù which highlights how we can find laughter among even the most challenging battles. When facing such a nail-biting environment, it is easy to forget we can exchange laughter rather than grief. Moreover, players like Thumbsdown_King offered strategic advice, underscoring how the mechanics of the game can lead to mishaps if not handled properly. Yet, it merely showcases that at times, riding the chaos is part of what makes the game so engaging. This thread captures the essence of what makes MMO gaming enjoyable‚Äîthe chance to revel in collective experiences, whether they are triumphant victories or the face-palm inducing blunders.
As gamers, we find ourselves wrapped up in the thrill of competition but also in the shared joys and pain that come with it. Threads like these remind us that, while we may get frustrated with ourselves, we can always turn to our fellow players for a laugh, support, or enlightening perspective. The banana peel slip-ups, the epic fireball misses, and the incredulous plays all weave together to create a story full of hilarity and friendship. Let‚Äôs carry this spirit of community and humor with us into our next Clash Royale matches‚Äîafter all, if we can‚Äôt laugh at our own mistakes, then what‚Äôs the point?
